data.description:
Connect your Meta Quest headset to devices with an HDMI or DisplayPort output, including handheld PCs or consoles, laptops, and more.

This app requires third-party hardware—specifically, a UVC and UAC compatible USB capture card and any associated cables. For a high-quality streaming experience, please ensure that the capture card and other USB adapters and cables are rated for USB 3.0 SuperSpeed.

# Features

* Auto launch app when a USB card is detected.
* Menu setting to control capture video format, frame resolution, and fps for each connected session.
* The screen is freely resizable, within certain limits.
* Toggle instant streaming stats by clicking anywhere on the screen.

# FAQs

**How do I troubleshoot a blank screen? Why can’t I play movies from streaming services? I hear only audio?**

* Capture cards do not display video if the HDMI signal has HDCP protection enabled.
* Make sure you are using the correct input port if your capture card has multiple HDMI/DisplayPort ports. 

**How to troubleshoot low video frames rate?**

Ensure the instant stats overlay in the streaming screen displays **SuperSpeed to confirm USB 3.0 speed, rather than Hi-Speed (USB 2.0 speed)**. 
* Not all USB-C cables are created equal. Some USB-C cables are rated for USB 2.0 speed.
* Some USB-C cables operate at USB 3.0 or USB 2.0 depending on the orientation of the connector; flipping the USB-C cable upside down may resolve the low fps issue.
* Change capture video frame format menu setting to match the fps offered by the capture card.

changelog.change_log:
Fixes and Improvements:
* Revamped UI to allow users to select capture video frame format, resolution, and fps
* Handled mic mute condition to address infinite USB permission dialog issue
* Added menu setting to control capture video format, frame resolution, and fps for each connected session. This feature enables users to take advantage of high-end capture cards and choose a capture card setting to mitigate low fps streaming experience. Note that some USB-C cables operate at USB 3.0 or USB 2.0 depending on the orientation of the connector; flipping the USB-C cable upside down may resolve the low fps issue.
* Users can now freely resize the screen within certain limits.
* Show a degraded performance message when USB 2.0 speed or below is detected or when the user selects a low fps video format.
* Streaming will now stop when the user takes off the headset and restart when the user puts it back on.
